title: [BUG] An exception is raised when trying to resize an SKBitmap image using an SKInfo structure.
body:
**Description**

An exception is raised when trying to resize an SKBitmap image using an SKInfo structure. The exception message is: "Passing the size parameters directly  into the function does work."

Passing the size parameters (width and height) directly  into the function does work.

**Code**
```
                    SKImageInfo info = new SKImageInfo
                    {
                        Width = (int)Math.Floor(bitmap.Width * 0.25),
                        Height = (int)Math.Floor(bitmap.Height * 0.25)
                    };
                    bitmap= bitmap.Resize(info, SKFilterQuality.High); // this line causes the exception

                    // doing it like this works:
                    bitmap = bitmap.Resize(new SKImageInfo((int)Math.Floor(bitmap.Width * 0.25), 
                        (int)Math.Floor(bitmap.Height * 0.25)), SKFilterQuality.High);

```

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
This is because the `SKImageInfo` has several other properties that are required. (I probably need better exception messages)

The most essential are:
- `Width` (defaults to 0)
- `Height` (defaults to 0)
- `ColorType` (defaults to `Unknown`)
- `AlphaType` (defaults to `Unknown`)

The recommended platform color type can be found on `SKImageInfo.PlatformColorType`. The recommended alpha type is `SKAlphaType.Premul`.

However, these are really just "typical defaults" as a bitmap/surface in SkiaSharp can be whatever you want it to be.

The constructors set those defaults because most of the time you just want to change the width and height, but again, they are just the typical defaults and sometimes you actually want other values.
